column4: need some help with getting pictures off cell phone -- anyone?
if cell phone is Palm device, I might be able to help.
pvt msg since this is off-topic?
motorola
sorry, not familiar.  Better luck elsewhere!
tried sudo mount /dev/sda /media/nameofdevice and it said didn't recognize it
but dmesg |tail -20 showd motororal phone

if it appears on /media/nameofdevice, then it would already be mounted (Ubuntu would do that automatically).  Someone else might be able to tell you how to mount it.  Only if the phone acts as a mass storage device; it might not.  (YOu can't mount a webcam, for example.)
what is the model of your motorola phone?  I'm trying to Google for you, but you haven't supplied a lot of info.
in Konversation: type "geekp" then tab.  Not sure in whatever the default is for GNOME Ubuntu.
do we know yet the model of your motorola phone?  I will give up if no info in 60 seconds.
someone took out the simm and put another one in T-Mobile I beleive, but with original simm it didn't work either

You're not giving info I need, so will try again one last time.  What is the model of your Motorola phone?  Example: I use a Palm Treo 650.  What do you use?  What is the machine that connects to your Ubuntu machine?
have almost no idea
Ah. Thanks for telling me.  I will give up now.
don't have it with me "charging" but not sure if that'll help
thanks anyway for your input
Congrats on new disk. I think boot partition can be any fs.
k thanks

You need to be more specific about "I can't boot up ubuntu".  It does not show a graphics screen?  Computer does not say it's booting?  You see your computer screen except the screensaver looks really ugly? etc. etc.
Hablo un poquito espanol, pero estaria mejor si usa la canale #ubuntu-es
